page.title: 15Farming, Rivers and Ponds.
page.content: There are two farms in Ecton village and one on the outskirts. They are arable farms with sheep and cows. There is a farm at Great Billing with livestock. To the south of Ecton village is the river Nene which is navigable. To the east of the village is Barton Brook and to the west is Billing Brook. Near Bellinge there are several ponds. The one nearest to the lower school has been there for 4 years. It used to be a rubbish tip. It has many uses including fishing, playing, school nature walks and sometimes boating. Various forms of wild life is in evidence there - birds, insects and animals. Also many trees and plants.
